description: Round ball-like shape, can grow extremely large (soccer ball to basketball size). White leather-like skin that peels off. Interior must be firm, pure white like marshmallow with NO gills, stems, or cap structures inside.
habitat: Open grasslands, meadows, fields, lawns, golf courses in nutrient-rich soil. Occasionally in deciduous forests. ALWAYS on ground, NEVER on wood or in trees. Often returns to same spot yearly.
season: Late summer to autumn. North America: July-September (most abundant mid-August to mid-October), Europe: August-November.
lookalikes: Immature Amanita species (Destroying Angel, Death Cap) - DEADLY - shows developing cap and stem when cut vertically. NEVER eat puffballs smaller than adult palm size (could be deadly Amanita button stage)
safety_notes: CRITICAL: Always cut vertically from top to bottom before consuming. Interior must be completely pure white with NO structures. Any sign of gills, stem, or cap formation = DO NOT EAT. If soccer ball size or larger, very unlikely to be Amanita.
